summary: Feature request to support asynchronous activity completion in TypeScript SDK, similar to Go SDK. Currently activities must return immediately even if work continues asynchronously, requiring workarounds with signals for long-running operations.
userImpact: Users cannot elegantly handle long-running asynchronous activities without creating extra signals or resource leaks in the worker.
rootCause: The TypeScript SDK lacks a mechanism to allow the worker to 'forget' about an activity so it can be completed asynchronously without worker tracking.
proposedFix: Implement asynchronous activity completion support similar to the Go SDK, allowing the worker to release ownership of an activity so it can be completed independently via the service client.
workaround: Use WorkflowService.respondActivityTaskCompleted directly, but this causes resource leaks as the worker continues tracking the activity.
resolutionDetails: Core support was added and implementation was planned by bergundy to be done after beta release.
keyQuote: In the Go SDK you can 'asynchronously complete an activity': we would like the same in node.
